title: Plutus Integration with Pony Lang
description: Some Cardano-based projects could benefit from the use of an actor model language with similar guarantees as Haskell. Scalability by design.

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like an interesting project to explore the ability to integrate Plutus with Pony. Given the tiny cost of 6000, it seems like it worth the risk to see what comes out of it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims to have good experience. The plan is to work on integration over a period of 6 months. Whilst success is no guaranteed, the proposer seems very motivated and dedicated to the project and is asking for a pretty small sum.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has given a plan with time line for delivering the implementation and documentation which will be published open source to git hub. This will make it easy to audit activity. Whilst the deliverables a re a little vague, the funding request is also quite small. No metrics or goals have been provided. It would nice to see some goals set for the number of dev's to use what is produced going forward.

f6_assessments.q0: This is experimental. It's not completely clear what good will come out of it, but just the better understanding of Plutus will be valuable. Also, the price makes it low cost worth the benefit.
f6_assessments.q1: The author looks competent and motivated, with previous experience, though a limited recent activity record on github. I rate only 4 rather than 5 because there's a lot of uncertainty involved.
f6_assessments.q2: The objectives are reasonably well-defined, but remain handwavy. It's all experimental, so hard to judge.

f6_assessments.q0: Great Idea about introducing another programming language to cardano ecosystem. but more language means more sdk and more integrations that in turn means more parts. The proposer does not give any information why the community need this new integration with Pony language. Also the proposer seem to give assumptions and not really sure how if it will works. The proposal fit into the challenge but there is no start date, for that I am neutral.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer seem to have relevant experience to successfully implement this Project , I have checked the github  profile provided , there is not enough git commit over the years to back up his claim. I think the amount requested is too small to implement this proposal successfully, for that i score 2
f6_assessments.q2: The Proposal lack clear road map , No metric  provided , so it will be difficult to sufficiently audit the progress and the success of the proposal , based on the information provided , i score 2

f6_assessments.q0: Pony lang is not popular and the actor-model is based on pi-calculus which is different than the lambda calculus-based Plutus. The new interface is pony can be useful but may not add much-required adaptation value to the current ecosystem. The developers in Cardano are trying to learn Plutus and Haskell which by itself is a new paradigm for most, adding one more language is likely to be a complicating step.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims that he has 15 years of experience in programming language design. However, his GitHub profile has very limited contributions and the referenced repository does not have enough information to assess the experience of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is research phase and aims to build a library for interfacing Pony and Plutus, with exact implementation details yet to be finalized. The scope is vast and not clearly defined. However, research projects can yield out of turn results and innovation can not be evaluated on the probabilities of success. Based on their evaluation it can be assessed the project is fairly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer seeks for funding in order to be able to further study/develop the interface of Pony with Plutus. As a result the desired outcome will help certain Cardano-based projects in scalability. Therefore this proposal fits into the challenge developer ecosystem. The impact on Cardano remains a little vague, since the proposer did not describe in detail how this interface/integration will help certain project and what projects that exactly could be. Adding this information would lead to a higher rating.
f6_assessments.q1: The presented plan shows which solutions the proposer wants to have found at which point in time. As this proposal correlates with others of the proposer, a positive interaction is to be expected. The budget covers the monthly costs for up to 6 months and is therefore considered extremely fair. To improve the proposal, more details (technical details) could be added. From my point of view this would make the proposed solution even clearer to understand. The proposer himself has participated in many community events (Swarm, After Town Hall) and has thus established the proof-of-life. More personal information and references would be helpful to evaluate the proposer's capabilities.
f6_assessments.q2: The outcome will depend on the research, i.e. it is not well defined yet. A Github repository is attached but without content yet. Presumably the progress will be presented there. A more detailed specification would help to show the community how to audit the progress of the proposal. In relation to the small amount of money requested and the possible benefits, it is a project that deserves its chance. However, for a better evaluation it needs the information suggested.

solution: Pony is a performant actor model language with guarantees like Haskell, and memory safety like Rust. Integration for PABs and side-chains.
experience: I've spent 15+ years studying complex systems with a focus on how primitives in language design can simplify the process of building them.
